bibl.title: Letter from Peter W. Suarez to Philip Showalter Hench, July 13, 1942

div1.p: Suarez requests that Hench return Dominguez' biography of Finlay to his widow.

div1.head: Letter from Peter W. Suarez to Philip Showalter Hench, July 13, 1942
div1.opener:
AMERICAN CAR AND FOUNDRY EXPORT COMPANY
30 CHURCH STREET
NEW YORK
July 13, 1942.
CABLE ADDRESS
CARMAKER, NEW YORK
Personal.
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Cr. Charles H. Slocumb,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I am an old friend of Dr. Francisco Dominguez, of Havana,
Cuba. In 1939 he sent me a manuscript of the Biography of Doctor
Carlos J. Finlay, which he had written, and which he wanted to
publish in several languages in this country. I got in touch with
the Waverly Press, Inc., of Baltimore, from whom I obtained a
proposal for the publication of the book and which I submitted
to Dr. Dominguez. The work was never put in hand because
Dr. Dominguez relied upon obtaining the necessary funds from the
Cuban Government.

Early this year, Dr. Dominguez had decided to publish
the book in English only out of his own resources, but unfortunately
he died in Havana, April 26th, 1942.

I wrote Dr. Dominguez' widow to inquire whether she
intended to go ahead with the publication of the book, and she
replied that she was not in a position to undertake such work,
and asked me to return the manuscript to her.

I communicated with the Waverly Press, Inc., and they
advised that, upon instructions of Dr. Dominguez, they had turned
the manuscript over to you under date of April 4th, 1941.
Dr. Dominguez overlooked to tell me that he had loaned the
M.S. to you, but anyway, my purpose now is to return it to
Mrs. Dominguez, in accordance with her request.

As you have had the M.S. in your possession for over
a year, perhaps you are through with it, and if so, I would
appreciate your suggestions as to the way of returning it to
Mrs. Dominguez. If you want to return it to her direct, her
address is as follows:
Sra. Tecla Boffil Vda. de Dominguez,
Gutierrez y Mendoza,
Marianao, Havana, Cuba.
On the other hand, you may send it to me here, or to the Waverly
Press, Inc., at Baltimore, so we may take care of forwarding it
to Mrs. Dominguez.

May I have the pleasure of hearing from you on the
subject?
Thanking you in advance, I remain,
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Peter W. Suarez- Address:
Peter W. Suarez,
c/o American Car & Foundry Export Co.,
30 Church Street,
New York, N.Y.
Copy to Waverly Press, Inc.,
Mt. Royal and Guilford Aves.,
Baltimore, Md.
Attn: Mr. Albert Beehler.
